title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire - BBC News
summary: paralym gb : 'i 'm really gutted ' , says silver medallist steadman .

documents.title: have a good weekend
text: that 's the end of our live coverage - thank you for joining us today .
the main story of the day concerns the sentencing of the driver who left the scene of a crash in which footballer shaun whiter lost his legs and his friend was seriously injured .
we 've also reported that two private school pupils from cambridge have denied stealing artefacts from auschwitz during a school trip to the former nazi death camp last year .
and there 's been a `` significant '' seizure of cannabis plants in wisbech .

and finally - good luck to our local paralympians in action over the weekend , including jonnie peacock in the t44 100m metre final this evening and the triathlon team who have three competitors from cambridge .
former swimming gold medallist clare cunningham is excited :
scroll down to catch up on the stories you may have missed .
we 'll return with regular updates on monday morning from 08:00 .
will be some great racing # paralym # triathlon # rio2016
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shaun whiter still suffers from 'flashbacks and nightmares ' following crash , court hears
text: in a victim impact statement read to the court , shaun whiter , who was n't present at cambridge crown court , said he still suffered from `` flashbacks and nightmares '' following the crash .
joey abbs sat with his head in his hands as the sentence was read to the court , while members of the victims ' families were seen wiping away tears throughout the hearing .

documents.title: judge says adamec 's actions were 'des
text: judge jonathan haworth told jan adamec that his actions were `` des adding : `` you were driving along that road in a manner that was patently dangerous .
`` you were driving , according to some witnesses , well in excess of 60mph . ''
an eyewitness reported seeing adamec driving without headlights and veering across the road in the moments before the collision .
both shaun whiter and joey abbs were wearing high-visibility vests when they were hit , and had placed a light on the road to alert drivers .
judge haworth told adamec : `` you reversed , you drove around the injured men , lying on the ground and you drove off . ''
adamec had also ignored a police appeal for information , and had attempted to flee from officers when they visited his address .

documents.title: verdict will allow crash victim 'to move on ' , says solicitor
text: the solicitor representing shaun whiter , who had his lower legs amputated after being involved in a hit-and-run collision , says today 's sentencing of jan adamec , the driver involved , will `` allow him to move on from the accident , and focus instead on the rehabilitation journey involved '' .

documents.title: weather : wet weekend ahead
text: there will be a few showers with clear intervals this evening , before cloud thickens and rain spreads eastwards across the region after midnight .
light to moderate southerly winds , with lows of 17c ( 63f ) .
saturday will be a cloudy , wet day with outbreaks of rain expected on and off through much of the day .
perhaps heavy at times , but becoming a little drier from the west later in the day .
moderate southerly winds turning westerly late in the day , with highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: paralym 2016 : go jonnie , go !
text: it looks like jonnie peacock was happy with his performance in the preliminaries of the t44 100m at the rio paralym
he lines up in the final tonight at 23:53 , hoping to replicate his success at london 2012 .
do you remember the sheer joy as he accepted his gold medal ?
you can follow the action from the games here .
good to get the legs moving again today 1 down , 1 to go .
lets see if we can have some fun !
really annoyed about the lack of media coverage on the paralym that made me miss your heat but will watch tomorrow
looked like there was 10.5 in those legs today !
good luck tomorrow and thank u for being such a good sportsman
brilliant , brilliant run ! !
fantastic and congratulations xxx # johnniepeacock
well done !
fantastic run
good luck today in your race i 'm sure you 'll smash it
good luck for the final .
you looked in awesome shape !
moving ? ! ? !
you smoked it !
great heat jonnie looking good !
go jonnie go
@ twitterid # supercharge where is the paralym inclusive # emoji ?
@ baotcot
good luck jonnie keep shocking the rest you can do it !
# gbpride # teamgb were all behind you in the uk

all looks good so far .
# rio2016paralym
good luck jonnie !
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: cam conservators invite public to name new boat
text: it feels like we 've been here before - a cambridge institution inviting the public to name a vessel but let 's not dwell on the somewhat controversial poll to name the british antarctic survey 's £ 200m research ship .
instead let 's focus on this - the cam conservators , which look after the river cam in the county , have a new boat to monitor the waterway .
the boat will be used for a variety of tasks , from blocking angry swans during boat races to tackling illegal punt operators .
suggestions are welcome via the conservators ' twitter page .
the cambridge news has published a list of the names that have already been suggested .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: parking warden attack : 'completely needless incident ' , say police
text: police have been giving their reaction following the sentencing of shamal asaad for an attack on a traffic warden in peterborough .
asaad was jailed for 18 months for the attack , which was caught on the warden 's bodycam .
the warden sustained a broken leg when he fell during the altercation in september last year .

det con josh coe said : `` the defendant lost all sense of perspective when he aggressively confronted and used violence towards the victim who issued him a ticket , resulting in the victim breaking his leg in two places .
`` this was a completely needless incident that has had a severe and ongoing impact on the victim 's work and personal life .
`` the public must show due respect to the work of enforcement officers on the streets , doing a difficult job in a workplace always exposed to public view . ''
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police say shaun whiter 's family are 'disappointed ' by adamec sentence
text: shaun whiter 's family are `` disappointed '' by the sentence given to jan adamec at cambridge crown court today , say police .

pc ashley bennett , from the bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire roads policing unit , added : `` three years , four months , whilst it seems like a long sentence , with good behaviour that 's reduced , and i think considering the severity of the injuries , it could almost have been a fatal collision .
`` i think yes , they 're disappointed . ''
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: cambridge school pupils deny stealing from auschwitz
text: two students from the perse school in cambridge have denied stealing culturally significant artefacts from auschwitz during a school trip to the former nazi death camp last year .

a court in krakow heard that guards at the site , which is now a museum , saw the then 17-year-olds up items from the ground , in an area where the germans stored the belongings of jews who were sent straight to the gas chambers .
the teenagers visited auschwitz in june last year as part of a trip organised by the independent school .
when police searched the pair , they found buttons , a rusted hair clip and fragments of a spoon and glass .

following police questioning , the pair were released after accepting a fine and suspended probation , but once back in the uk the students withdrew their admission of guilt and polish prosecutors decided to settle the matter in court .
the judge heard the teenagers had only up the items to show to their guide .
they deny a charge of stealing artefacts of special culture importance , which carries a maximum prison sentence of 10 years .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paralym 2016 : jody cundy takes to the track
text: jody cundy has been tweeting his pride at paralym gb 's early successes in the velodrome at the rio games .
the cyclist - who grew up in wisbech - will get his own medal quest under way tonight .
he 's in action in the men 's c4 1km time trial from 20:30 .
catch the action here .
well done @ twitterid well deserved silver , and congrats on your 12th gold @ twitterid # rio2016
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: shaun whiter 'could n't face ' seeing jan adamec , says police officer
text: pc ashley bennett , one of the officers who attended the scene of the collision on 1 july in newmarket , said it was `` absolutely horrifying '' .
since then he 's been involved with the investigation , and has also been in contact with the families of both shaun whiter and joey abbs .
he added : `` it 's been extremely difficult seeing mr whiter and mr abbs as they are .
as well as the physical injuries , there 's the emotional and mental injuries that they 're also suffering .
both men are absolutely distraught .
`` mr whiter could n't even be here ; he could n't face seeing mr adamec today . ''
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: crash victim 'still coming to terms with his injuries ' , says solicitor
text: returning now to the sentencing of jan adamec , a statement read out by eleanor howie , solicitor for one of his victims , joey abbs , said : `` this is an incredibly sad case in which the careless actions of a driver left two young men with serious and life-changing injuries .
`` joey is still coming to terms with his injuries and the long road to recovery he now faces .

`` the guilty plea entered by the driver spared joey and shaun the stress and anxiety of a long trial and the sentence handed down today has helped him draw a line under what has been a very difficult time .

`` we are working with joey to help him to overcome his injuries in the best way he can and we will be looking to help him to access the funds he will require for his ongoing therapy and recovery . ''
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: background to jan adamec sentencing
text: shaun whiter , who lost both of his legs in the hit-and-run crash that led to jan adamec being sentenced today to three years , four months in prison , spoke out about him last month .
mr whiter said : `` without a doubt it 's good to know that the guy is off the streets .
`` being 27 , i did n't dream of this .
personally , i think i should n't have to deal with this , but it 's a case of now i have to deal with this , and i hope he 's aware of that . ''
the crash happened on dullingham road in newmarket on 1 july , at 22:55 .
joey abbs ' vauxhall astra had a flat tyre , and he pulled up on a pavement and called his friend for help .
mr whiter came to his aid , parking his black bmw 320 behind .
a ford focus then crashed into mr whiter , who was standing behind his vehicle .
the force shunted the bmw forward , pinning mr abbs between the two cars .

documents.title: driver 's actions described as 'des and callous '
text: judge jonathan haworth has described the actions of jan adamec as `` des and callous '' .
adamec failed to stop after a collision on dullingham road in newmarket on 1 july , and has today been sentenced at cambridge crown court to three years , four months in prison .
the collision led to shaun whiter having both his legs amputated , and his friend joey abbs receiving serious leg injuries .
mr abbs spent six days in hospital , and mr whiter was released on 29 july .
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: guilty plea reduces prison sentence for haverhill man
text: a haverhill man has been given a prison sentence of three years and four months for causing serious injury to two men by dangerous driving .
the judge at cambridge crown court said the maximum sentence he could impose was five years , but he reduced the term because jan adamec had previously pleaded guilty to the charges .
one of his victims , shaun whiter , 27 , had to have both his legs amputated after the collision .
he worked as an estate agent in stansted , essex , and was due to begin training with newmarket town fc .
his legs were crushed by adamec 's vehicle as he tried to help his friend joey abbs fix his car on dullingham road at 22:55 on 1 july .
mr abbs , who played football with cambridgeshire team soham town rangers , was trapped between his and mr whiter 's vehicles .
he suffered serious leg injuries .
adamec did not stop after the accident .
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: breakingthree years , four months in prison for driver who caused life-changing injuries to footballer
text: jan adamec , 40 , from shetland road , haverhill , has been sentenced at cambridge crown court to three years , four months in prison , for causing serious injury by dangerous driving in newmarket on 1 july .
more to follow
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: local newspaper round-up
text: here 's what 's also making the news in cambridgeshire today :
the cambridge news reports that architects in the city have concerns about the city deal being pushed forward without `` wider regard to the urban fabric '' .
a series of thefts from vehicles in sawtry this week are being linked by police , according to the peterborough telegraph .
and the wisbech standard has the story of a man who was arrested for being six times over the drink-drive limit .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash victim arrives at court for driver sentencing
text: i 'm at cambridge crown court , where jan adamec is due to be sentenced following his guilty plea to two counts of causing serious injury by dangerous driving , following a collision in newmarket in the summer .
mr adamec , 40 , drove into shaun whiter and joey abbs as they changed a flat tyre in newmarket , suffolk , on 1 july .
mr whiter 's legs were amputated and mr abbs sustained a serious leg injury .
joey abbs has recently arrived at court .
author: Vikki Irwin
BBC Radio Suffolk political reporter

documents.title: weather : dry with sunny spells but odd showers possible
text: sunny spells this afternoon but also few showers are possible .
it 'll be rather breezy too and it 'll feel less humid than recent days .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 73f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: have you seen chatteris ' special stones ?
text: the curator of chatteris museum , ian mason , is asking for the public 's help to track down some special stones around the town .
the main chatteris abbey was demolished in the mid-1500s , with a surviving building eventually being demolished in 1847 .
mr mason thinks there may be stones from the abbey scattered around chatteris and is asking for local residents to keep an eye out for them .
they may have particular markings .
there 's a history walk around the town from 18:30 tonight .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'tsumani ' of wasps creating a buzz
text: a pest controller from bottisham says cambridgeshire is facing a `` tsunami '' of wasps .
dave pearce said calls about the insects have more than doubled in the past week .
he said the warm spring and late summer has led to a greater number this year .
he said : `` in another week or two , it 'll settle down .
the wasps will die off from october when the queens leave the nests . ''
dee ward-thompson , technical manager at the british pest control association , said : `` we have noticed that queries about wasp control on our website have been increasing year-on-year since 2013 .
`` the milder winter , coupled with a warm spring and warm conditions in the last few weeks , means there are more wasps , which tend to be more aggressive at this time of year . ''
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: post office prayers for paralympian peacock
text: olympic t44 100m champion jonnie peacock defends his title tonight at the rio paralym ( 23:53 ) .
his home town of doddington has strung out the bunting ( and we suspect it has the champagne on ice ! )
this is how the local post office looks today .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: £ 600,000-worth of cannabis plants seized in wisbech
text: cannabis plants worth an estimated £ 600,000 have been seized by police .
officers discovered about 1,000 mature plants at a warehouse in march road , friday bridge , near wisbech , at about 13:30 yesterday .
police are investigating the discovery , which they believe is linked to organised crime .
no arrests have been made .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sentencing due for driver who caused life-changing injuries to footballer
text: a man who admitted causing a crash that resulted in a footballer having both legs amputated , is being sentenced today at cambridge crown court .
jan adamec , 40 , drove into shaun whiter ( left ) and joey abbs ( right ) as they changed a flat tyre in newmarket , suffolk , on 1 july .
mr whiter , who worked as an estate agent in stansted , essex , was due to begin training with newmarket town fc and had both his legs amputated .
mr abbs sustained a serious leg injury .
adamec , of shetland road , haverhill , has admitted two counts of causing serious injury by dangerous driving .

documents.title: light aircraft crash report reveals gust of wind to blame
text: the air accidents investigation branch has published a report into a crash involving a light aircraft at sutton meadows airfield , near ely , earlier this year .
the pilot of the pegasus quik gt450 - similar to the one below - was injured and the aircraft severely damaged .
the report states that as the pilot was attempting to land , there was a gust of wind which resulted in the left wingtip making contact with the ground .
the pilot lost control and the aircraft came to rest beside the runway .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new peterborough waste facility means 'no more landfill by 2020 '
text: the operator of the new energy recovery facility ( erf ) at fengate in peterborough says the city is on course to `` stop using landfill for household waste by 2020 '' .
erfs are small power stations that use waste which has already been through the recycling process .
andrew turner , from operator viridor , told us the six-month old facility has the capacity to cope with the rapid growth in peterborough 's population .

`` peterborough city council is one of the first in the uk to actively say they want to divert their waste away from landfill and have built in capacity for the future as they have growth plans , '' he said .
he added the facility was stringently regulated by the environment agency and it regularly monitored the flue gases it produced .
he said : `` it 's predominantly water vapour , carbon dioxide and nitrogen - it 's very small trace levels . ''
curious members of the public can go behind the scenes at the site today and tomorrow as part of the heritage open days programme .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : sunny spells developing
text: today will generally have a cloudy start across the region , although some warm sunny spells should develop .
a few showers are also possible .
top temperature today of 23c ( 73f ) .
here 's my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: st neots atm raid : spar reopens
text: as we reported yesterday , £ 25,000 was stolen in a cash machine ram-raid at the spar on cambridge street , st neots , in the early hours of thursday morning .
police said the raid caused `` significant damage '' , as seen in the below .
spar , which runs the shop where the cash machine was located , says it `` takes this matter very seriously '' .
`` repairs are being made to the store , it has been confirmed as safe and the store has reopened .
we are working with police as they investigate this case , '' a spokesman said .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning
text: hello again .
it 's a beautiful sunny morning in cambridgeshire , we 'll take a look at the day 's weather forecast in full shortly .
in the news today :
we 'll also have all the latest travel , sport and weather throughout the day .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email us , tweet us or contact us via facebook .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed over traffic warden assault
text: man jailed over traffic warden assault

documents.title: man jailed for attacking parking warden
text: man jailed for attacking parking warden

documents.title: goodnight from all at cambridgeshire live
text: that 's the end of our live coverage - thank you for joining us today .
we 've heard how £ 25,000 was stolen during a jcb ramraid in st neots - and about a peterborough man who was jailed after an altercation over a ticket left a parking warden with a broken leg .
meanwhile , athletics gets under way in the rio paralym tonight .
the much-anticipated 100m t44 heats feature defending champion ( and doddington man ) jonnie peacock , and starts at 21:42 .
scroll down to catch up on the stories you may have missed .
we 'll return with regular updates tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: watch : the moment a parking warden was attacked after issuing a ticket
text: earlier we brought you the story of how a parking warden was left with a broken leg after he was attacked over issuing a parking ticket .
shamal asaad was jailed for 18 months for the assault , which you can watch below :

documents.title: weather : a sunny evening but temperatures will fall
text: a sunny evening will lead to a dry night but temperatures expected to fall .
a light to moderate south-westerly breeze should prevent any mist and fog forming .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
tomorrow will be a day of sunny spells and scattered showers but it will be breezy .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 73f ) .
more details from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: 'thank you seems inadequate ' , says runner 's wife
text: the wife of a man whose life was saved by an off-duty special constable says he `` was a very lucky person , because the only chance he had was to have someone right there who could do cpr '' .
mary sullivan , 67 , was taking part in the same race at wellingborough when her husband tom collapsed .
he was saved after selly rowles , whose day job is at a software company on the cambridge science park , stepped in to help .
tom is out of hospital and recovering at home in northampton .
mary said : `` thank you seems inadequate . ''
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: off-duty special constable saves the life of a fellow fun-runner
text: a special constable who saved a man 's life when he collapsed during a race says her `` training took over '' .
selly rowles , 32 , was running a five-mile race at wellingborough when she noticed some runners calling for a marshal .
tom sullivan , 67 , had collapsed into a ditch , so the cambridgeshire police special `` went into autopilot '' and kept up cpr until the ambulance arrived 30 minutes later .
she said : `` i was told that what we did before the ambulance arrived had kept his blood circulating and kept him alive - that was when i realised that what we did had saved his life . ''
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: tea cosies out and tobacco in : a victorian guide to cambridge student life
text: as hundreds of students get ready to turn up at cambridge university for the first time , st john 's college has shared a guide to student life , victorian-style .
the tongue-in-check the fresher 's do n't was published in 1893 by st john 's undergraduate arthur john story .
there was advice on meeting girls ( it would be nearly 100 years before women were allowed to attend the college ) .
plus , it advised on the need to offer tobacco to guests ( regardless of whether you smoked ) and how tea cosies and sugar tongs were not needed .
and good news for townsfolk - arthur story did not approve of `` undergrads , walking four-a-breast , jostling all comers , even ladies , into the gutter '' .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: meeting taking place tonight to discuss future of minor injuries units
text: the latest meeting to discuss the future of minor injuries units is taking place this evening in march .
in july , a leaked report by the clinical commissioning group considered shutting the units in ely , doddington and wisbech due to financial pressures .
the ccg says no decision has yet been made .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'the chair enabled me to leave the house '
text: rachel mitten from sawston told me why her stolen wheelchair was so important to her @ twitterid 95.7/96fm 1026mw .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: the dos and don'ts of victorian students
text: the dos and don'ts of victorian students

documents.title: man jailed for attacking parking warden
text: man jailed for attacking parking warden

documents.title: thousands raised to replace stolen wheelchair
text: a crowdfunding page set up to pay for a new wheelchair for a sawston woman has raised nearly £ 1,500 .
the distinctively painted electric wheelchair belonging to rachel mitton was stolen from a van in wisbech last friday .
she says it gives her `` freedom '' and she relies on it to get around , as she suffers from a severe progressive and debilitating illnesses .
she says since it 's gone she 's `` become the needy person that no-one wants to be '' .
the fund is hoping to raise £ 8,500 .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: local paper round-up
text: here are some of the stories featuring in the cambridgeshire newspapers today .
the peterborough telegraph reports a woman was sexually assaulted as she walked along eastfield road in the city .
the varsity explains how the cost of a cambridge education is now double the tuition fee .
and the cambridge news says more than 10m raspberry pi mini computers have now been sold .

documents.title: ticket attack : parking officer now needs 'constant pain relief '
text: members of the public came to the parking warden 's assistance after he was assaulted and he was taken to hospital .
although he has since returned to work , the officer said he has been left with semi-permanent nerve damage for which he needs `` constant pain relief '' .
he also said walking was `` uncomfortable '' and he was `` much more apprehensive '' .

at peterborough crown court today , shamal asaad , 30 , of kipling court , peterborough , was sentenced to 18 months in jail , with a further three months each for two further charges of destroying and damaging property , to run concurrently .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: parking ticket attack 'like something out of a horror film '
text: after the initial aggression , the parking warden called for police back-up and then shamal asaad got into his car and drove off .
minutes later the officer saw the car parked in the street again , he approached it and was attacked by asaad .
the officer can be heard shouting `` he 's grabbed my equipment '' as he fell to the ground .
`` i will never forget the feeling of panic when i was lying on the ground with my attacker 's face , centimetres from mine , contorted with rage .
it was like something out of a horror film , '' the officer said .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: ticket attack : parking warden left 'terrified '
text: the parking warden , who works for peterborough city council , described the attack on him as `` one of the most terrifying of my life '' .
he issued shamal asaad with a ticket for parking illegally in a residential permit area in the city .
asaad then emerged from a nearby house , took the ticket from the car and began waving it in the officer 's face .
he appears to complain it is the second ticket he has received that day .
the officer , who wanted to remain anonymous , can be heard saying : `` back off , i 'm warning you , back off . ''
asaad can be seen demanding the officer takes the ticket back and swears several times before he assaults him .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: £ 25k taken in st neots atm raid
text: we 've just heard from police that £ 25,000 was stolen in the cash machine ram-raid at the spar on cambridge street , st neots , during the night .
at about 02:30 , a jcb forklift truck ripped the atm from the wall and it was then loaded on to what police believe was a white truck .
it then fled the scene , heading towards cromwell road with a dark saloon .
police said the raid caused `` significant damage '' , as seen in the below and the store remains shut .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed over parking ticket attack
text: a man has been jailed for 18 months for attacking a traffic warden over a parking ticket .
he was assaulted by shamal karim asaad ( 30 , on hankey street , peterborough , after he gave him a penalty charge notice ( pcn ) for parking illegally in a permit area last september .
the officer 's bodycam shows him repeatedly telling a furious asaad to `` back off '' before he was struck and fell , breaking his leg .
asaad denied grievous bodily harm , but was found guilty and given a custodial sentence at peterborough crown court .
he was also sentenced to three months each for two further charges of destroying and damaging property , which will run concurrent .
we 'll bring you more on this story , including that bodycam footage soon .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: man denies baby 's manslaughter
text: man denies baby 's manslaughter

documents.title: investigation continuing after sus 'suitcase ' found in huntingdon
text: police investigations are continuing after a sus suitcase was discovered at barclays bank on market hill in huntingdon yesterday .
part of the road was closed on wednesday afternoon , but the barriers were taken down at 17:30 and the road re-opened .
cambridgeshire police says a robot entered the bank and examined the case , which was believed to be empty .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: st neots spar closed until further notice
text: the spar in st neots has been shut after its cash machine was ripped from the outside wall in the early hours of this morning .
cambridgeshire police is trying to trace the atm , which was taken in the raid .
due to an incident overnight our store is closed until further notice .
apologies for any inconvenience caused .

documents.title: office 'bake off ' gets personal
text: while we try and find out a bit more on the st neots ram-raid , we thought we 'd bring you this amusing tale from the office
it seems all is fair in love and war when it comes to the great british bake off .
inspired by the hit bbc one show , peter swan , sports producer at bbc radio cambridgeshire , decided to make his own version of newmarket 's frankel , the wonder horse .
he thought it was a remarkable likeness , until a work colleague said it was more like a hippo
peter 's response ?
`` harsh '' , but it `` tasted better than it looked '' .
my contribution to the @ twitterid bake off - newmarket 's finest , frankel .
a remarkable likeness
it looks like something frankel might have done pre-race mate ...
thanks plum !
it tastes better than it looks .
i have no words for this .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jcb rips cash machine from spar store
text: cambridgeshire police has confirmed a `` lift truck '' was used to pull a cash machine from the wall of a spar store in st neots .
officers were called to the theft in the early hours on steeple court , cambridge street .
the below shows the shop before it was raided .
we 'll bring you more information when we get it .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: cambridge news : 'jcb cash machine raid ' in st neots
text: the cambridge news has dramatic images of damage caused after a reported ram-raid at spar in st neots .
it says the incident has left a massive hole in the shop 's wall after its cash machine was hit with a jcb at about 02.30 .
we 'll bring you more when we get it .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: disused cambridgeshire church to be knocked down
text: meanwhile , a dilapidated church on ermine street north in papworth everard is set to be demolished .
the go-ahead to knock down the st francis of assisi roman catholic church was also taken by south cambridgeshire district council yesterday .
four new apartments are set to be built on the site .

documents.title: separate access road to bassingbourn dry ski slope approved
text: we 're not going to `` pop any champagne corks '' , says martin middleton , vice chair of the bassingbourn snowsports centre .
it comes after south cambridgeshire district council approved the building of a new access road to the dry ski slope , which has been redundant since the barracks were mothballed .
he says he 's `` pleased '' with the verdict , but adds he 's realistic , saying people `` still might not be able to use '' the slope if other stages in the planning process fall through .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: re-opening of dry ski slope in bassingbourn moves a step closer
text: plans to allow bassingbourn dry ski slope to re-open have moved a step closer .
south cambridgeshire district council has approved plans to allow a separate access road on guise lane to be built so the site can be accessed independently .
it now means negotiations can take place between the snowsports centre and the defence infrastructure organisation ( dio ) to see if it can rent or buy the sports facility off the government .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : long delays on a47 around guyhirn
text: there are long delays in both directions on the a47 fen road in guyhirn , between the a141 march road junction and the nettle bank junction , because of a broken down vehicle .
update : # a47 between guyhirn & # wisbech .
long delays in both directions due to a broken down vehicle .
consider using alternative routes .
@ twitterid
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: woman 'desperate ' to get stolen wheelchair back
text: yesterday we reported the story that thieves stole a van containing a £ 8,500 specially-adapted wheelchair from wisbech .
the chair was used by rachel mitton , from sawston , who suffers from severe fibromyalgia , a very painful rheumatic condition .
i went to meet her this morning and she was visibly upset and is `` desperate to get it back '' .
she says it 's `` ripped her world apart '' as she `` ca n't exist or function without my wheelchair '' .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: today 's weather : feeling fresher
text: it 's due to be bright with sunny spells this morning .
turning cloudier this afternoon , with the chance of a shower and feeling fresher .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : severe delays on a1 in biggleswade
text: there are still severe delays and queuing traffic on the a1 southbound near biggleswade because of an accident earlier on .
all lanes have now been re-opened .
congestion goes back to lower caldecote .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning and welcome back to regular updates from the local live team here in cambridgeshire .
between now and 18:00 we 'll bring you all your news , sport , travel and shortly a full weather report .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's it for today
text: our live coverage has come to an end for the day - thank you for joining us .
we 've been bringing you reaction to a video showing a driver undertaking a group of cyclists on a road near cottenham - by mounting the verge and driving along a cycle path .
we have also been following the story of law firm baker small .
the firm earned £ 352,000 in fees from cambridgeshire county council , but was dropped by the council following tweets it sent `` gloating '' over cases it had won against families .
and cambridgeshire police will begin using drones as an eye-in-the-sky to help with investigations , after a nine-month trial .
scroll down to catch up on the stories you may have missed .
we 'll return with regular updates tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
have a good evening .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: diver dan pays a visit !
text: and finally
as paralym fever grips , let 's wallow in olympic glory again for a moment or two .
bronze medallist dan goodfellow - who made the podium with dive partner tom daley in the 10m platform - popped in to show off his medal and have a bit of fun with the bbc cambridgeshire team .
he may be an olympic medallist , but what other secrets can he share with us ?
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel update : milton road delays
text: milton road in cambridge is partly blocked by a broken down vehicle , and police are asking drivers to avoid the area .
for up-to-date information , have a look at bbc travel .
there is a broken down vehicle on milton road cambridge .
traffic back to the elizabeth way bridge .
please avoid area .
police are on scene .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: paralym 2016 : invictus golden girl 'one to watch'cambs
text: do you remember sgt elizabeth marks ?
she 's the swimmer who gave her invictus games gold medal to prince harry and asked him to pass it on to papworth hospital staff who saved her life earlier this year .
she fell ill while preparing to compete in the inaugural invictus games in 2014 , but now she 's been tipped as `` one to watch '' by bbc sport in the rio paralym which open officially today .
she goes into the 100m breaststroke in the sb7 category as the world leader and favourite for gold .
full coverage here .

documents.title: distinctive wheelchair and van stolen in sawston
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a van and a distinctive wheelchair were stolen in wisbech .
the wheelchair has been signed by various artists and features wings and a skull and cross bone .
owner rachel mitton , from sawston , suffers from severe fibromyalgia and relies on both the van and the electronic vehicle to get about .
the van is a silver mercedes sprinter van which contained the £ 8,500 specially adapted wheelchair .
it was taken sometime between 01.15 and 10:00 on friday 2 september from elm road in the town .
anyone with information is asked to call the police on 101 .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a dry night ahead
text: cloud will continue to clear away to the northwest overnight leaving a dry night with lengthy clear spells , but some shallow mist patches are possible later .
tomorrow will be asunny start to the day across most of the region and staying dry , but variable amounts of cloud spreading in from the west as the day progresses .
a little breezy with moderate westerly winds and highs 23-26c ( mid 70f ) in the east of the region , but feeling fresher further west .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: huntingdon evacuation : several streets cordoned off
text: barclays on market hill in huntingdon has been evacuated following the discovery of a sus package .
hunts post 's sophie day has been tweeting from the scene
bomb disposal team called to @ twitterid in # huntingdon after reports of a sus package
hi sophie - it 's sue over at the bbc , may we embed your tweet in online coverage ?
thank you .
hi sue , yes that would be fine but as long as it is credited to the @ twitterid and that the website link is left in .
of course - thank you !

documents.title: huntingdon evacuation : area around market square closed
text: the area around market square in huntingdon has been cordoned off following the discovery of a sus package at barclays bank on market hill .
miranda kenny has tweeted this from the scene .
you can share your with us using # cambslive .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sus package leads to bank evacuation
text: a bank in huntingdon has been evacuated following the discovery of a sus package
the barclays building has been evacuated and a cordon put in place .
parts of princes street are closed , with pedestrian areas closed from chequers court to george street .
people are urged to avoid the area until further notice .
an explosive ordnance disposal team is currently on site .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police team welcomes 16 drone pilots
text: in total bedfordshire , hertfordshire and cambridgeshire policing teams have five drones that cost £ 1,000 each .
four will be used regularly , with the fifth held as a spare .
the drones can travel at 36mph ( 58km/h ) , fly in 25mph ( 40km/h ) winds and up to 400ft ( 122m ) in the air .
they can also travel at a distance of 500m ( 0.31miles ) , but only if the pilot can see it to control it .
sixteen pilots have been trained to use them from departments including roads policing and armed policing .
author: Anna Todd
BBC Look East

documents.title: drones to help frontline policing
text: the policing teams of bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire have officially unveiled the drones they are now using to help with investigations , operations and keeping the public safe .
they 've been trailed for nine months and their use is now a permanent fixture with the team across the three counties .
the image below is footage taken from today 's press launch at alconbury in cambridgeshire .
author: Anna Todd
BBC Look East

documents.title: what the local papers say : 70-year-old computer gets a reboot and aerial views of st ives ' fire
text: let 's take a look at what else is making the news today :
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: devolution consultation results show a majority in favour
text: more than half the people in cambridgeshire and peterborough support the idea of devolution , according to the results of a public consultation .
the consultation of nearly 4,000 people was made up of an online and telephone poll .

of the 2,000 people asked by research company ipsos mori on what they thought of about cambridgeshire and peterborough having a combined authority led by a directly elected mayor , 55 % said they agreed in principle .
the results will now be sent to the government who are expected to give the final green light to the arrangement by the end of the year .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: devolution consultation results announced
text: we 've just been given the results of the consultation into the cambridgeshire and peterborough devolution deal and more than half of the nearly 4,000 people who took part have said they support the principle .

the deal would bring a lot of money to the region , including £ 170m for housing and £ 20m a year for infrastructure , but the controversial point has been the idea of an elected mayor who would oversee the new authority .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: paralym 2016 : jonnie peacock raring to go
text: reigning paralympic champion jonnie peacock says he says he does n't care what else is going on around him at rio - he 's entirely focused on the 100m in the games , which open tonight .
he 's been telling us that he 's shut out all the recent controversies involving russia 's blanket ban and the funding crisis surrounding the games .
`` nothing 's ever going to come close to london 2012 .
as a sporting performance , winning rio would be incredible . ''
the heats of the t44 100m take place on thursday from from 21:42 .
you can follow the action here .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: how law firm baker small works with local authorities
text: how baker small operates :
what is the provision for children with sen ?
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: baker small director calls accusations of bullying tactics 'utter rubbish '
text: a law firm which has secured payments in legal fees and contracts worth £ 3m with local authorities across the country says claims it used bullying tactics are `` utter rubbish '' .
baker small was employed in cases where councils were in dispute with parents over what they were prepared to provide to children with special educational needs .
the law firm was criticised for mocking parents of children with special needs on twitter in june .
it has since been accused of using intimidating tactics to win cases .
director mark small said : `` this thing about tactics and conduct of tribunals on behalf of local authorities is just not true . ''
he said his company had tried to `` look at improving decision making before it gets anywhere near a dispute , because that is often the problem '' .
he did , however , admit that in some cases `` additional evidence comes to light or is provided late '' .
mr small said he regretted the tweets .
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: council says baker small 'did not do its dirty work '
text: law firm baker small did not do `` our dirty work , '' cambridgeshire county council said .
a bbc investigation has found the company secured £ 3m in payments for legal fees and contracts nationally since 2010 , including more than £ 350,000 in cambridgeshire .
the company was sacked after posting tweets mocking parents of children with special needs in june .
the council had already paid £ 144,000 to the firm last year .
a council spokesman said it has `` finite resources , and resourcing decisions have to be fair and equitable for all children and young people .
`` unfortunately this can mean that disagreements are escalated to requiring a decision from a tribunal . ''
he added : `` baker small did not do the council 's 'dirty work ' - they provided legal expertise which was not available in-house . ''
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: council finds new legal provider after special needs tweet row
text: we 've discovered cambridgeshire county council has just issued a new tender worth almost £ 500,000 for legal representation at special educational needs tribunals .
this will effectively be used to fight cases brought by parents .
parents can begin an appeal if they feel their child is being denied support they 're entitled to .
research by the bbc shows councils lose 86 % of cases which go to tribunal nationally .

cambridgeshire county council said it is `` confident the successful applicant will follow appropriate procedures to ensure taxpayers ' money is spent correctly and will seek to work constructively with parents where possible . ''
baker small , the law firm previously used to contest these appeals , made headlines in june after it mocked parents on social media .
the council sacked them , but had already paid £ 144,000 to the firm last year .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: cambridgeshire county council spent £ 352,000 on baker small
text: cambridgeshire county council spent more than £ 350,000 on the services of law firm baker small between 2010 and 2016 .
the law firm , criticised for mocking parents of children with special needs on twitter , secured payments and contracts nationally totalling £ 3m since 2010 .
cambridgeshire county council ended its contract with baker small following the tweets .
baker small director , mark small , said he regretted the posting of the tweets in june .
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: 'gloating ' sen tweets law firm baker small paid millions
text: a law firm criticised for mocking parents of children with special needs has been paid millions of pounds in legal fees by local authorities , the bbc has learned .

baker small , which tweeted gloating comments about families it had won cases against , has secured £ 3m in payments and contracts since 2010 - including significant sums from norfolk , hertfordshire and cambridgeshire county councils .
critics said the spend was `` depressing '' and could have been used to help children rather than `` fight parents '' .
baker small 's mark small said he regretted the tweets posted in june .
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: drones now used in front line policing
text: after a nine month trial , police forces across bedfordshire , hertfordshire and cambridgeshire will now be able to use drones .
i 'm at the special launch taking place today and will bring you more on this story later .
we 're launching our tri-force drones project to media today at # alconbury @ twitterid @ twitterid
drones `` to protect media '' .
how exactly ?
hi david , it 's a drone project that we were showing media .
author: Anna Todd
BBC Look East

documents.title: stetchworth centre targeted in second break in
text: yesterday , we reported that the ellesmere centre in stetchworth had been closed after the post office was targeted by thieves .
cambridgeshire police has told us they were called to the centre again this morning , following reports of a second burglary .
one person , believed to be a man , was seen running across a nearby field , away from the centre .
the rear fire doors had been forced open along with an internal door and the fire alarm box damaged .
it is not believed that anything was taken during the burglary .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car on cycle path : champion says driver behaviour was 'absolutely astounding '
text: the actions of a car driver who used a cycle path to undertake a group of cyclists by driving along a designated cycle path are `` absolutely astounding '' , noel kavanagh , cambridgeshire county council 's cycling champion , said .
the video of the manoeuvre , captured on saturday by riders from ely cycling club , has been shared widely on social media .
`` it 's absolutely astounding that someone in a car can act like this .
what a frightening experience for the riders , to have an idiot like that act in that way , '' mr kavanagh said .

`` because they are club riders , they are probably doing something like 25mph plus and would likely encounter pedestrians on cycle path , '' and for safety reasons it 's `` perfectly legitimate for club riders to be out on the road . ''
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car on cycle path : police reaction
text: a video showing a group of cyclists being undertaken by a car driver between rampton and cottenham - who mounted the verge and drove along a dedicated cycle path - has been shared widely on social media in the last 48 hours .
cambridgeshire police has told us that the incident has n't been officially reported , but they are aware of the video and its contents .
a police spokesperson said : `` it is important all road users share the road and remember that drivers and cyclists have equal responsibility on the road to drive and ride safely . ''
`` when overtaking a cyclist , motorists should leave as much room as they would give a car .
if there is n't sufficient room to pass , hold back .
undertaking any vehicle is dangerous and could lead to an accident . ''

documents.title: watch : car undertakes road cyclist on cycle path
text: we 've been bringing you reaction this morning to a social media video showing a car driver undertaking a group of cyclists - by driving along a designated cycle path .
the footage - filmed by a member of ely cycling club - was captured on saturday .
many of the comments on social media have focused on the correct use of designated cycle lanes and paths .
peter nunn commented : `` i so often wonder why cyclists do n't use the cycle ways which are provided for their safety and the safety of others .
can any cyclists tell me why ? ''
among the replies posted , david stanbridge says that `` sadly the so called cycleways in my neck of the wood ( peterborough ) are not fit for purpose and downright dangerous . ''
official advice from the highway code is that `` use of these facilities is not compulsory and will depend on your experience and skills , but they can make your journey safer . ''
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car undertakes cyclist using cycle path : your reaction
text: ely cycling club has released footage of what appears to be a car using a grass verge and path to undertake its riders .
the club told us that the incident , filmed by one of its riders , happened between rampton and cottenham during a ride on saturday .
there 's been a mixed reaction on our facebook page overnight .
in support of the cyclists , emma may wrote : `` if cyclists are going above 18mph , my understanding is that they should not be on a shared cycle/footpath , for the safety of other users ``
meanwhile , joe evans commented : `` rule 61 re : cycle lanes from the highway code 'use of these facilities is not compulsory and will depend on your experience and skills ' .
while i understand it can be frustrating when stuck behind a cyclist on the road , the only person breaking the law and endangering lives in this video is the car driver . ''
others are more sympathetic to the car driver .

tom shaw wrote : `` not content with causing traffic , slowing everyone else down , creating an obstacle to swerve around ( into the opposing lane ) and whinging as loud as possible - they now also enjoy wasting tax payers money on cycle lanes that they do n't even use ``
adam langridge said : `` bravo to the car driver , i experience this every day on my commute .
frustrating that the council spent £ 3million on a nice smooth cyclepath , yet cyclists still ride on the road ! ''
keep your comments coming to our facebook page .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wednesday 's weather : dry with some warm sunny spells developing
text: although it will be a dull start this morning , any mist and fog will lift early on and the cloud will gradually break through the morning with some warm sunny spells by the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live on wednesday
text: good morning - it 's a warm and muggy one across cambridgeshire - we 'll take a look at the day 's weather forecast in full shortly .
in the news today :
we 'll also have all the latest travel , sport and weather throughout the day .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email us , tweet us or contact us via facebook .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car uses path to overtake cyclists
text: car uses path to overtake cyclists

documents.title: car uses path to undertake cyclists
text: car uses path to undertake cyclists

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live coverage has come to an end for the day - thanks for joining us .
today , we brought you the story of the motorist who caused a bus crash in peterborough on christmas eve .
yasmin kauser has been fined and received six points on her licence .
the major fire at a st ives recycling centre yesterday was most likely caused by a lithium battery , according to cambridgeshire fire and rescue .
and our paralympians have begun their final preparations for the rio games , which start tomorrow .
scroll down to catch up on the stories you may have missed today .
we 'll bring you any developments when we return with regular updates from 08:00 tomorrow morning .
any major news stories will be featured here overnight .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: closure of a10 level crossing to pedestrians : 'we do n't understand the logic '
text: cycle campaign group camcycle says it 's concerned about the proposed closure of a path for pedestrians and cyclists over the railway crossing at foxton .
the new off-road cycleway linking cambridge to royston passes over the crossing , but network rail has proposed closing one side of the crossing where it crosses the a10 .

campaigners say it means cyclists would have to cross the road twice to cross the railway at the station , which would be difficult at busy times , and could stop people using the route on their bikes .
susan van de ven , county councillor for melbourn , said : `` we do n't understand the logic .
`` local roads come to that point too ; it 's a very complex junction .
adding a new crossing would make things more complicated and difficult . ''
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy and muggy overnight , humid tomorrow
text: this evening will be dry with some sunny spells .
it will then be another cloudy , muggy night with areas of mist and fog .
temperatures are unlikely to fall below 16c ( 61f ) .
any mist and fog should gradually clear tomorrow with a better chance of the cloud breaking to allow some spells of sunshine , especially in the afternoon .
saying humid with highs of about 25c ( 77f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: thieves make off with charity boxes
text: the ellesmere centre in stetchworth has been closed today after the post office was targeted by thieves .
four suspects broke into the building in the village at 23:00 last night , making off with a number of charity collection tins .
sally mann , who 's the postmistress , says they used cutting gear and were filmed by the cctv system .
she said : `` it took them five minutes to get through the door and they were all masked and wearing gloves . ''
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jewellery haul found in the river cam
text: is there something missing from your dressing table ?
cambridgeshire police suspects these items of jewellery , found dumped in the cam , were stolen , and wants to track down the owners .
they were found near stour bridge common by a member of the public who was fishing on 26 august .
the items include a number of brooches , necklaces , bracelets , earrings , rings , cufflinks and a watch .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cereal firm expands into new peterborough premises
text: a cereal company in peterborough , which makes own-brand cereals for several major supermarkets , has moved into new premises .
bokomo foods can now make 50m bowls of cereal each month at its new factory in orton southgate .
john hiles , the company 's chief executive , told us the cereals industry is a competitive environment and `` that critical to our future growth was the issue of efficiency and cost '' .
`` the new factory will allow us to expand and we will improve efficiencies across all areas to enhance the overall offering for our customers , '' he said .
author: Dotty McLeod
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: paralym 2016 : jody cundy shows a bit of leg !
text: paralympian jody cundy 's cycling leg has had a bit of a makeover since london 2012 - as you can see in this video .
jody , who 's from wisbech , describes it as `` pretty cool '' .
he 'll be taking part in the 1km time trial in the c4 classification and the mixed c1-5 team sprint , in what will be his sixth paralympic games .
his first event will be the time trial on friday , starting at 20:30 .
you can follow all the action here .
it 's all change for cyclist jody cundy at the rio paralym # rio2016 # paralym ( via @ twitterid
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: fine for christmas eve crash driver
text: fine for christmas eve crash driver

documents.title: peterborough bus crash : car driver 'pulled out without stopping or slowing '
text: we 've been bringing you news that the driver of the car which crashed into a bus on christmas eve has been fined and had points added to her licence .
peterborough crown court heard yasmin kauser caused the crash when she failed to stop at a t-junction and hit the side of the single-decker bus on broadway .
the bus then drove into the guide dogs uk shop front causing substantial damage .
thirteen people were hurt , one seriously .
no pedestrians or people in the building were injured , the court was told .
the court heard that she had been driving for 20 years and had a clean driving licence .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paralym 2016 : at the holding camp
text: tomorrow the paralym 2016 will open with a grand ceremony in rio .
many of our local competitors are winding down their final preparations at the belo horizonte holding camp .
paratriathlete clare cunningham , from cambridge , has been tweeting about her last few training sessions before her event , the women 's pt4 triathlon , which begins at 14:00 on sunday .
clare was previously a gold medallist at the barcelona games in 1992 as a swimmer .
meanwhile , sprinter laura sugar 's old university chums have been sending her their best wishes on social media .
she will run in the t44 100m and 200m , with the preliminary heats taking place just before midnight on thursday .
laura 's from saffron walden and was a double bronze medallist at the 2014 ipc european athletics championships .
you can follow all the action from rio here .
had a great first few days out here in belo horizonte , all settled in now fantastic facilities too !
@ twitterid
best of luck sugar .
you super star ! ! !
thanks dude
another stunning day in belo , making the most of the great training facilities with @ twitterid # supercharged
@ laurasugar1 , we 're all wishing you good luck for # rio2016 !
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: peterborough bus crash : car driver fined
text: as we just mentioned , a woman who whose car struck a bus in peterborough on christmas eve which then ploughed into a charity office has been given a fine and points on her licence .
yasmin kauser , 46 , of park road , peterborough , admitted driving without due care at the city 's magistrates ' court .
thirteen people were hurt in the crash on broadway , one seriously , and the bus also caused substantial damage to the guide dogs uk building .
today she was fined £ 92 and ordered to pay costs of £ 105 .
her licence has been endorsed with six penalty points .
the court heard one mistake by the defendant , normally a careful driver , had caused the accident , which happened shortly before midday .
graham allen , prosecuting , described the crash as a `` serious injury road traffic collision '' .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingpeterborough bus crash : car driver sentenced
text: a peterborough woman whose car collided with a bus last christmas eve , which then hit a building , has been sentenced .
yasmin kauser , 46 , had admitted driving without due care when 13 people were injured on broadway .
she 's been given six penalty points and fined £ 92 at peterborough magistrates ' court .
she was also ordered to pay £ 105 in costs .
more to follow .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingst ives fire : lithium battery likely cause
text: fire crews have now left the site of yesterday 's recycling plant fire in st ives , having spent the night damping down .
cambridgeshire fire and rescue has just told us the fire was accidental .
it is believed the most likely cause was a lithium battery that was caught up in recycled electrical items .
the fire broke out at the plant , off caxton road , just after 14:20 yesterday .

station commander dave lynch , one of the officers in charge of the incident , said : `` the main building where the fire started has been completely destroyed , however , fire crews worked extremely hard to prevent the fire from spreading anywhere else . ''
he added the situation could have been a lot worse , given the number of other industrial units and businesses in very close proximity .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: future of wisbech castle uncertain
text: the future of wisbech castle was the subject of an extraordinary meeting of the town council last night .
the site is currently owned by cambridgeshire county council , but it wants to sell it to raise money for services .
the first castle was built on the site in the town centre nearly 1,000 years ago , but there are fears it could fall into private ownership .
roger powell , chairman of the the friends of wisbech and fenland museum , says its history means it should be kept as a civic amenity .
`` i think it would be criminal if the building fell into private hands , '' he said .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel update : a14 partly blocked
text: the westbound a14 is partly blocked following an accident , between junctions 24 and 23 .
the eastbound carriageway is also reported to be moving slowly owing to onlookers , between junctions 23 and 25 .
you can find the latest travel news for cambridgeshire here .
# a14 westbound between j24 ( godmanchester ) & j23 ( spittals way ) - lanes partially blocked due to accident .
expect delays .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: st ives fire : crews remain on site
text: but first off today , fire crews remain at the scene of yesterday 's blaze in st ives .
the fire broke out at a recycling plant in an industrial unit off caxton road yesterday afternoon .
at the height of the blaze , more than 30 firefighters were on scene and local roads and bus services were affected .
this morning the fire service tweeted this message to residents living in the local area
an investigation into what caused the blaze is under way .
crews will be at the scene of # caxtonroad # stives fire to dampen down the area , but fire is out .
residents advised they can open windows
great job guys .
i hope you know how valued you are
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : murky start , but sunny spells are coming
text: it 'll be a cloudy start but becoming brighter , with sunny spells developing through the day .
a high of 25c ( 77f ) .
here is my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to today 's live page for cambridgeshire .
it 's a dull , cloudy morning - we 'll have the full weather forecast for you shortly .
among the stories we 'll be looking at today - welcome news of a manufacturing success in peterborough .
if you 'd like to get in touch throughout the day you can email us , tweet us or contact us via facebook .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live coverage has come to an end for the day - thanks for joining us .
we 've been focussing on a big fire at a recycling centre in st ives this afternoon , which dozens of fire crews have been working to put out .
group commander chris parker told our reporter he thought the firefighters would be leaving the scene within the next hour .
we 'll bring you any developments when we return with regular updates from 08:00 tomorrow morning .
any major news stories will be featured here overnight .

documents.title: st ives blaze : no-one injured , fire service says
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue group commander chris parker also told me no-one was hurt in this afternoon 's blaze at the recycling centre in st ives .
`` everybody was evacuated from the recycling centre and surrounding factories , '' he said .

he also said that at its peak there were 10 appliances dealing with the fire , as well as a `` considerable '' police presence and a hart team ( hazardous area response team ) from the ambulance service .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: st ives fire : location confirmed as recycling centre
text: i 've been speaking to chris parker from cambridgeshire fire and rescue service and he 's confirmed the blaze happened in a recycling centre on caxton road .
`` when crews arrived , the fire had taken hold and the majority of the building was involved , '' he told me .
`` we have a number of offices and factories in close proximity and residential properties at the back , and crews have worked hard to stop the fire spreading . ''
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: st ives fire : from the scene
text: i 'm at the caxton road site where a fire 's been blazing at an industrial estate for a while now .
i could see what was happening from cambridge - you can see the great plume of smoke .
it took place on the industrial estate at 14:40 this afternoon .

i 've covered many such fires for the bbc over the years , but i have to say as far as sheer scale of number of appliances and emergency services go , this is pretty much up there with the biggest of them .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : dry tonight and warm tomorrow
text: it will be mostly dry but rather cloudy tonight with a few clear intervals , with temperatures only falling to 15c ( 59f ) .
tuesday will start rather cloudy but gradually brightening-up , with some sunny spells developing for the afternoon .
temperatures potentially as high as 26c ( 79f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: st ives fire : what we know so far
text: our live coverage this afternoon has been dominated by news of a large fire at an industrial estate in caxton road , st ives .
here 's what we know about the blaze :

documents.title: st ives fire : residents 'still urged to avoid area '
text: crews are still using jets to tackle the fire in st ives , cambridgeshire fire and rescue service says , adding they have surrounded the blaze in order to contain it .
`` residents still urged to avoid the area and keep doors and windows closed , '' the service tweeted .
crews tackling the # caxtonroad # stives fire with jets .
residents still urged to avoid area and keep doors and windows closed
do we know which company is the one affected ?
we can confirm it was a recycling premises on caxton road

text: # stives - caxton road industrial estates still closed .
however closures lifted b1040/a1123 and marley road/burrel road .

documents.title: 'firefighters are doing well '
text: shelly chapman 's been tweeting of the st ives fire taken by her husband dave , who works on the industrial estate .
she says work by the firefighters is starting to have an impact on the blaze .

documents.title: your st ives smoke plume lessening
text: lucy rickerby has sent us a few photos of the caxton road fire in st ives this afternoon .
this latest from lucy , along with others on twitter , appears to show the situation getting a bit better .

@ twitterid and if anyone 's expecting a parcel tomorrow your probably not gon na get it .

text: as we 've been reporting for the last hour , firefighters in st ives are currently dealing with a `` large '' blaze at an industrial unit in caxton road , st ives .
people living nearby have been asked to keep their doors and windows closed , and 30 firefighters are working on getting the fire under control .
the fire service just posted this on twitter .

documents.title: weather : mainly dry
text: today 's weather has been stark contrast to last week 's has n't it

spells of warm sunshine could creep through towards the evening .
highs of 19c .

author: BBC Weather

documents.title: eu referendum immigration debate : 'compromises ' will be made
text: you may have seen in the news today that prime minister theresa may has rejected a points-based system for controlling eu migration - one of the key promises of leave campaigners during the referendum .
peterborough mp stewart jackson ( bbc radio cambridgeshire that the idea of `` pulling up the drawbridge '' on people coming to the uk is `` not what was promised or what will happen '' .
mr jackson , who 's parliamentary private secretary to brexit secretary david davis , said a `` compromise '' is needed on future immigration policy .
`` clearly we 're a global trading nation .
we will have to have people , '' he said .
however , former cambridge mp , lib dem julian huppert ( below ) , responded by saying that `` realities are dawning on ministers and senior brexiteers '' .
`` what [ the leave campaign ] promised simply was n't do-able , '' he said .
`` negotiations are not going to look as they 'd fantasised '' .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: building fire 'started deliberately '
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue service has released this photo of a derelict building it says was deliberately set on fire in the early hours of this morning .
the blaze occurred on the first floor of the building on padholme road east in fengate , peterborough .
anyone with information has been asked to contact police or crimestoppers .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local news site round-up
text: here 's what 's making the headlines on the county 's other news sites today :
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: world 's biggest hide-and-seek bid 'just short '
text: a country park looking to break the world record for the biggest ever game of hide-and-seek has just missed the mark , it is understood .
more than 1,000 people turned out for the record-breaking attempt organised by cambridgeshire search and rescue ( camsar ) at milton country park near cambridge .
it is thought the total turnout , while `` close '' , was just short of the target , according to organisers .
however , the exact number has yet to be confirmed .
the current guinness world record for a hide-and-seek game involved 1,437 people , set in china in 2014 .

documents.title: weather watchers : rain on the leaves ( and everywhere else )
text: it 's not looking any brighter out there yet , according to the photos in our weather watchers inbox .
we 've got our fingers crossed
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: political analysis : loss of east 's mep will hit labour
text: this news east of england mep richard howitt is standing down will come as a big blow to labour supporters in the east .

for many years richard howitt has been the face of labour in the region , the linchpin who held the party together after the the disastrous election defeat of 2010 , the politician who could always be relied on to turn up at a local branch fundraiser .
but what will also come as a blow will be the fact that he has chosen to leave politics now .

as an mep , he knows he will lose his job when we leave the eu in a few years time , but for now there is still a job to be done in brussels arguing for the uk 's interests as brexit negotiations get under way and the party would more than likely have rewarded his hard work with another job back in britain .

friends tell me that jeremy corbyn 's leadership of labour has been a factor in today 's decision : he worries for the future of the party he loves and he fears labour will be unelectable for some time to come .
but he also feels that as a british mep he is starting to lose his influence , he 's in his mid-50s and wants another career challenge before retiring .
there are many reasons for his decision , but there 's no denying that for labour in the east this is a big loss .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: public transport improvement hopes for mitcham 's corner
text: the friends of mitcham 's corner is hoping that public transport in the area may be improved as a result of plans to redevelop the road system .
chair of the group , ann cooper , said it `` would certainly like to see a much better bus service to the area '' .

`` [ we 'd like ] to see the park and ride buses and the guided bus get to stop at mitcham 's corner , and a proper coordinated hub so you could get from one bus to another for an onward journey , '' she said .

documents.title: mitcham 's corner to become a destination ?
text: i 've always thought of mitcham 's corner as somewhere you need to get through to get into town .
it 's got a very confusing one-way system where chesterton road , milton road and victoria road all meet , and vehicles often speed around there .
there 's a big office supplies store dominating the area and a block of terraced housing that looks like it 's been plonked next door .
then there 's also the former tivoli pub , still boarded up after that fire back in march 2015 .
there are banks , shops and pubs sprinkled in-between this lot too .
all of this makes it pretty difficult for pedestrians and cyclists .

it 's not much of a destination at the moment as sam owens , who runs the thirsty wine shop , told me : `` mitcham 's corner is a part of cambridge that has perhaps not been somewhere that people would rush to come to in the past . ''
but cambridge city council is producing a plan to redevelop the whole area .

the best case of which would see an open space and traffic reduced and slowed down , with more priority for pedestrians and cyclists , according to the council 's urban design and conservation manager , glenn richardson .
a public consultation into these plans officially started at 09:00 today .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: mitcham 's corner 'difficult and confusing '
text: plans to revamp mitcham 's corner in cambridge - a `` difficult and confusing '' system - are now open to public scrutiny .
the area has been examined by cambridge city council which found it `` outdated '' , `` confusing '' and `` underused '' .
kevin blencowe , in charge of planning policy and transport at the council , hopes the changes will allow the area to `` meet its potential as a thriving local centre '' .

documents.title: breakinglabour mep for east of england to stand down
text: a senior labour mep has announced plans to stand down from the european parliament later this year .

east of england euro-mp richard howitt , who has been in the european parliament for 22 years , said he is to become chief executive of the international integrated reporting council ( iirc ) , which links companies with society , the environment and the wider economy .
mr howitt , as well as being the senior serving mep for the east of england , is also the labour spokesman on foreign affairs in the european parliament .

he is also the socialist and democrat group human rights spokesperson , the european parliament rapporteur on corporate social responsibility and the president of the all-party disability rights group of meps .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: mitcham 's corner revamp consultation starts
text: there are plans to make cambridge 's mitcham 's corner `` a place people want to go , rather than have to fight through '' .
a public consultation into plans for a revamp , costing up to £ 4m , gets started this morning .
it includes scrapping the frequently congested one-way gyratory system , which was introduced in the 1970s , and replacing it with two-way streets .
sneak preview of my report on cambridge mitcham 's corner revamp for @ twitterid on monday morning @ twitterid
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

a few cloud breaks are possible later which will bring spells of warm sunshine for some of us , with a high of 21c ( 70f ) .

documents.title: welcome to local live for cambridgeshire
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for cambridgeshire .
it 's a dull , cloudy morning out there today - we 'll have the full weather forecast for you shortly .
plus , in the news this morning , plans to regenerate the mitcham 's corner area of cambridge at a cost of up to £ 4m are due to go out to public consultation .
we 'll bring you more on this soon .
if you 'd like to get in touch throughout the day you can email us , tweet us or contact us via facebook .
